title: Trivia
description: Andy hopes to make up for a sales deficiency by entering and winning a bar trivia competition, while Dwight flies to corporate headquarters in Florida to demand a management interview with Robert.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [No one is talking in the office, Jim holds up sign that reads "We're on the longest silent streak in office history! Nobody has said anything in... 14 min!", Dwight hangs up on a phone call rather than speak, Andy sees a raccoon eating a hamburger and tries to describe it using charades, Kevin opens a candy bar and takes a bite]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh yeah!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Aw!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Knew it! I knew it! Soon as I heard that wrapper.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You really have to say "oh yeah" every time you eat a candy bar?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I can't help it, Oscar. It's just really good. [takes another bite] Oh yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, not bad at all. I think we can beat 20 minutes though so let's try again. Get it all out now if you have to.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It was a raccoon! Eating a hamburger like a person!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You need to stop banging your pen on your desk or it's going to drive me insane.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, done.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [shows bloody hand] Does anyone have a first aid kit?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Check out this song I wrote: I'ma love you downstairs tonight... [overlapping chatter]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, here we go! Everybody get read in three, two, good luck, one-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [writing on board] Love letters, yes! I love it. What else can be done with paper?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You can write a book about chairs.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Books! Excellent, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy, please! Please, just stop. You can do infinite things with paper-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [gasps] Shh! Did you hear that? Infinity! There is an infinity of things that you can do with paper! Now, who wants to buy some paper? [scattered applause]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Very nice. Very nice sales pitch for our clients that don't know what paper is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm talking about you guys! Who in this room, right now, wants to buy some paper? Let's get high on our own supply!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy, you want us to buy our own paper?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Robert said that we needed to double our sales growth to eight percent by the end of the quarter. That's today. And we're eight hundred and thirty dollars short. And I can't afford to keep buying paper from us. So today, we need to sell eight hundred and thirty dollars of paper and the next quarter I need to sell the twenty-two hundred dollars of paper that's in my garage.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Animals, machines, vast virtual armies. All of these things I have successfully managed. The only thing I haven't managed is people. I saw an ad on the Sabre website for an open manager position in their printers division. I spoke to Robert California about it and he said for me to come by and see him sometime. So, like a Spanish conquistador, I have come to Florida to claim what is rightfully mine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute for Robert California!

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.text: Oh, hello Mr. Schrute. I'll tell him you're here. Can I get you anything at all?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not here to be given anything. I'm here to take what is mine.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.text: Ooh. I'm glad you're on our team. Here, please have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Dwight? What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gabe? You don't know?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Course I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmm. Impressive office you have here. Surrounded by shrubbery, like a squirrel's office.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Corporate says to me, "Gabe, we need you in Scranton." Scranton says, "Gabe, go back down to Florida. You're needed there." So, Tuesdays and Thursdays, I'm up there. Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, I'm down here. I can think of no better way to confront my deathly fear of flying.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Robert.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You made it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Impressive initiative. I don't know what's worse, the trip or the destination. [Gabe laughs] Well, uh, let me settle in and I'll be with you shortly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very good.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey C-span. So my dad says an accountant can really help you out, if they're willing to "play ball." Those were his words.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Gosh, Andy, you had a great quarter. Okay? Robert will understand. Eight hundred dollars is a rounding error!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So make that error!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy, no-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey! I can make that error.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [clicks tongue] Aw...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, it's just, I know that making errors sounds like your kind of thing, but it's a little more complicated than that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, I-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's just, I really need a real accountant on this. [to Oscar] What do you say?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm leaving early today because tonight I have a trivia contest in Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Any other crunch time, I would love to stay in, cook the books for you so you can save face in front of your CEO, but tonight is Triviocalypse!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's only the biggest night of trivia of the year. There's a thousand dollar prize. I'm committed to my friends, they're committed to me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know what? Go. Have fun.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There's a trivia contest at a bar in Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop right there. I love it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I didn't even say what it is.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's trivia.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: In Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But here's the best part. The prize is a thousand dollars, and if we win, we can use that money to buy paper here, close the gap on our eight percent profit increase...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's a great plan.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah? You like it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, good stuff.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm so psyched you guys are into it because I thought- I was like, "this sounds really stupid."

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You just made a good idea, a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There is one problem with this plan.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We'd have to leave work, like, right now, to do this.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [on the phone] You can reduce your prices by ten percent or we're going to be finding a new source for our morning bagels. All right. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gabe, I always wondered what it is you did around here. Now I found out. You're the bagel guy.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah. But not just bagels. All unwanted problems. Question: What's the most important appliance in your house?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Meat grinder.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [makes buzzer sound] Too slow. It's the toilet. And I am the toilet of this office. I flush away annoying problems so others can keep their hands clean. And, just like a toilet, I am essential.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, Gabe? You could have gone with garbage disposal, incinerator or eraser, and instead you chose toilet. God bless you. You're an American classic.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Dwight. Today is not my day at all, I'm afraid. I'm not going to be able to meet with you, but I'm leaving you in the very capable hands of our COO.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But I can give you this pitch in one minute-

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: No, he's going to meet with you later. No, no, no. I don't want you to rush it, okay? Trust me. Meet with Bill. He's a great person to know. I'll dialogue with him tonight. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: CEO to COO. What a difference a letter makes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Still an important position. Still a chief.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You're really going to like Bill. He, uh, he has me toilet a lot of people for him. [Dwight sighs, Gabe's phone rings] Hallway phone, Gabe Lewis speaking.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Gabe, listen to me. Don't bother Bill with this. He has to go put out a fire on the home front. Just wait twenty minutes and then I want you to listen to Dwight's pitch. Make him feel valued. Make him feel heard.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Your wish is my command.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's a command.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't believe this. What are you doing here, Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You left us no choice, but, this should put a smile on your face. How would you like to be captain of the Dunder-Mifflin team? Although I reserve the right to overrule you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What? No!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I've got a quota to hit. I don't care how I hit it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: And you guys thought this was a good idea?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought it was a fun idea.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: There were times on the two and a half hour drive when I experienced doubt. That's the thing about long drives, you know, you're always going to- this is a gay bar.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wait, what? Everyone in here is gay?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes! It's a gay bar! So you guys want to go home now?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: No. Nah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What does this say about you? That you followed me here? That you think you're going to win your sales quota? At a gay bar's trivia night? [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It says that I believe that my staff's intelligence and that I'm willing to try anything. [Oscar's friend walks up] Not anything.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, all right. We need to divide up into teams, but it's winner-take-all so no need to divide evenly. We need an A-team, a backup team and a just-have-fun team. So you guys all know yourselves.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Good-timers follow me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Backups. [Jim goes to join the backups]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Go on, kid. You know you don't belong here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A-team.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right, everybody. Nice self-awareness. Except... [looks at Kevin, who has joined the A-team]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There's a table over here.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: All right, first question everyone: Ray Charles famously had this state on his mind. What is its capital?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, we got this!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Let's reverse engineer this. You're a black singer. Where do you go? Somewhere where you're a novelty. Alaska?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Atlanta.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh I know you think that, because that's where the Olympics were held.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: My cousins were actually at those Olympics.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Keep talking all you want.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: How am I supposed to know what was on his mind? Ooh, what do blind people think about?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, dogs, canes, signs, manholes, stairs, piano, darkness.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Okay, time's up. Let's get the boards up. "Atlanta, Georgia" is the correct answer. [Kevin holds up "What is...SEE-attle"]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey man, uh, look. Unfortunately, Bill had to go fight a fire, so your appointment got-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sniffs] There's no fires within eight miles of here.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well, it's nine miles away. I'm going to be meeting with you on his behalf.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? No, no. Excuse me! Lady! Get anyone from the COO's office on the phone this instant!

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.text: This must be very frustrating.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I can see you in the jungle now.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Okay, now, you're not an all-star of the NBA, but you did get your game on when you won the NBA's Sixth Man of the Year award in 2011. Who are you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim, Darryl. Your time to shine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Shawn Marion.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes, Shawn Marion.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That doesn't sound right. I want to say, LaDameon Washington.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wrong, for so many reasons.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, I know Elizabeth Taylor's sixth man was Richard Burton. Is that helpful?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That's it. I'm going to go watch the boats on the river.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ron Artest, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, it's Lamar Odom. If it'd been Ron Artest, it would have come up in Dancing with the Stars, when they pan over his trophy case when he's at home with his family. Lamar winning Sixth Man was a big storyline on Chloe and Lamar.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: All right, boards up. Let's see who got it. "Lamar Odom" is what we were looking for. "Lamar Odom" Thank you. [scattered cheers]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God. Lamar Odom, yes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nicely done!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're my sports guys! You're ESPN, you're ESPN Classic, Ryan is MSNBC. I'm E!, TLC and Oxygen.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Chill, man. This plan is airtight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So it's a very simple argument of why I should be put in charge of southeast printer sales. Nobody has sold more printers in the northeast than me. Bottom line, I know the product. I get it!

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.text: Well, you got my vote.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Most of all, I believe that character is destiny. And my character is one that- wait why are you smiling?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's with the smile?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You're doing great. You know, so good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And my character is one that will never give up until greatness is on the horizon, behind us.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Dwight, that was a fantastic presentation. Put your hand on my hand. Flush! [Gabe makes a flushing motion, Dwight twists Gabe's arm] Ow!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Take me to Robert.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ow! He went home.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Take me to his house.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Uh, it's a condo and it's long-term business housing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know where it is. Lead me there.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ow! Ow! Stephanie, help!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen, you're a perfectly fine toilet. I'm just an extraordinary piece of crap. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Excuse me, sir, on the Dunder-Mifflin A-team? Excuse me, sir?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: I'm sure you're just checking your Grindr account... [laughter] but you can't check smart phones during trivia, it's against the rules.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, I'm turning it off.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Okay, you're not turning it off.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I won't look at it.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Sir?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can't- I can't not touch it.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Okay, then we're going to have to take it away. [employee takes the phone] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Look, I can't, I can't not have my phone. I'm sorry. I want to be with my phone. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: All right, guys. After nine rounds, let's check the scores. In first place, with nine points, it's Aesop's Foibles. [Oscar's team touches fingers] The Queerenstein Bears have seven points. [a team of hairy men growl] Dunder-Mifflin A-Team has four points.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [claps] All right.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: D.M. Backup Team has three points. The Einsteins have eight points. [the "just-for-fun" Dunder-Mifflin team cheers] Ladies Gaga have five points. [more cheering]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So the best chance of hitting our mark is now in the hands, and brains, of Kevin, Meredith, Erin and Kelly. Do I like these odds? My answer is no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which one is it?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I don't know. All I know is the building.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Robert! Robert California! Robert!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Dwight! How nice of Gabe to show you where I live. Come around. 102.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: All right guys, time's up. Who was the relatively unknown patent clerk who discovered that energy equals mass times the speed of light squared? Looks like everyone gets a point for Albert Einstein. Oh wait. Except for the Einsteins. That's all right. Which means the top three teams are going to finish it off in the speed round. So let's get everyone some bells. In third place we have the Einsteins.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh yeah!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What! [cheers]

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: In second place, we have the Queerenstein Bears.

quotes.speaker: Queerenstein Bears
quotes.text: Whoo! Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: And, in first place, is Aesop's Foibles.

quotes.speaker: Oscar's Friend
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, we're going to get clobbered.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Ring it in when you know it. First question: This man had a fatwa declared on him when- [Erin rings bell] Einsteins?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I did my part, babe. I'm just the bell girl. [Oscar rings bell]

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Aesop's?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Salman Rushdie.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Salman Rushdie is correct. [applause] Heading out to sea, sailors. On a square-rigged ship, the sale set furthest forward is called what? [Erin rings bell]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Princess Ding-Dong, do not hit that bell unless-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Flying jib.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Flying jib is correct for the Einsteins. [cheers and applause]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Shalom. [sighs] Give us just a minute. Stu and I are just finishing up our lesson. Trust me. One nine-minute bout is a cardiovascular equivalent of running uphill for three hours. [grunt] I could go to the gym three times a week or I can wrestle Stu once a month. [slaps the mat, they wrestle]

quotes.speaker: Stu
quotes.text: Grab my knee!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yay Robert!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Guys, please help yourself to some drinks from the fridge.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: According to a recent survey, this is the most common learning disability among American adolescents.

quotes.speaker: Oscar's Friend
quotes.text: [rings bell] Boom! ADHD!

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: No. [another bell rings]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wrong. The answer is dyslexia!

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: That's correct for the Einsteins. [cheers and applause]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [dances] Whoo! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Sir-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Go Einsteins!

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Dial it back, this isn't Tail Feathers, okay? [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: They haven't really improved on the Oreo, have they?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Sit down, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me tell you why I should be the next manager with a riddle: A manager, a salesman, a leader and a warrior walk into a restaurant. The hostess says, "table for one?" How is this possible?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You were dining alone? All those people are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, exactly. Riddle number two: Who is going-

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Ah-ah-ah- your drive, your ambition. It would be wasted on a manager's job. And Florida, you don't want to live here. Even I don't want to live here. That's why I'm always at my place in Scranton. Florida is America's basement: It's wet, it's filled with mold, strange insects, alligators. Alligators are dinosaurs, Dwight. You know that, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: N... it's complicated.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [holds a medal to the light] This medal was my grandfather's. He received it for acts of courage. For excellence. It's a tribute one man gives another. I could give you a job, Dwight. Why not let me give you something even better? [holds out medal]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a job interview, not a flea market.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Dwight, the job is not right for you. Now, when something comes along that is right for you, I'll try you out. Now get the hell out of my place.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Final round. Last two teams squaring off. I hope you're ready to play doctor. Our question is about health and the human body.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, come on!

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: The standard American analog scale has a maximum capacity of what weight? [bell rings]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Three hundred pounds!

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: Point for the Einsteins. [applause] Here's your final question. Cinephiles, put on your memory berets: This 2001 masterpiece from Gilles Paquet-Brenner explores the intricate dynamics of a family in disarray.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [rings bell, answers in French] Le titre du film est Le Scaphandre et le Papillon.

quotes.speaker: Oscar's Friend
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: I'm sorry, no. Over to the Einsteins.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [rings bell] Les Jolies Choses.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Marie Cotillard exposes herself a number of times in that film.

quotes.speaker: Host
quotes.text: The Einsteins win it! [applause]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Look, I know it's easy to say tonight was just a fluke, and maybe it was, but here's a piece of trivia: a fluke is one of the most common fish in the sea. So if you go fishing for a fluke, chances are, you just might catch one.

quotes.speaker: Stonewall Host
quotes.text: Welcome to the Stonewall Alliance Trivia Championships! First prize is forty-five hundred dollars!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Let's just do our thing, collect our hardware and get the hell home.

quotes.speaker: Stonewall Host
quotes.text: Riboflavin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [holds up "Robitussin"] Riboflavin?

quotes.speaker: Stonewall Host
quotes.text: Michigan. [Kevin holds up "A Mitten"] The President of the United States is "P.O.T.U.S." [Kevin holds up "P.O.T.A.T.O."] John Steinbeck wrote The Grapes of Wrath. [Kevin holds up "The California Raisins"]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Cause it's like, really...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Einsteins! Great work.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know what I thought would be fun? Is we do like uh, a switch-em-up maybe? Since only one of us needs to win, maybe I can get Kevin and Kelly and put together an all-star team?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Andy, there is no switching teams.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Andy, we're fine. We don't wanna switch. We're already like, the perfect unit.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright. Well just stay focused, try to concentrate.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Whoo! Brought some brain food.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Having fun.

quotes.speaker: {Meredith} & {Kelly}
quotes.text: One, two, three...[team takes shots]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: When I dropped out of school to watch more sports, a lot of people thought that I was nuts. Well who's laughing now?

quotes.speaker: Announcer
quotes.text: Say "Shalom" to your shrubs on this Jewish holiday that celebrates the new year for trees.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Tu Bishvat!

quotes.speaker: Announcer
quotes.text: That's correct.

quotes.speaker: Einsteins
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Announcer
quotes.text: Point for the Einsteins.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hey, is it true that you're not allowed to spend time with your girlfriend during the month of Tu Bishvat?

quotes.speaker: Announcer
quotes.text: Uh, I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I knew it. I knew it. I knew it. Ryan lies to me and says he has a whole Jewish holiday for an entire month.....

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It gets better, kids. It gets so much better that one day, your stupid coworkers will be excited to show up at your gay bar and ruin your trivia night.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, if you're not going to help us out by buying our own paper, could you sell eight hundred dollars more paper than usual today? That would be amazing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, it's the last day of the quarter. We've already called all our clients, so making that much in a day is going to be tough.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not helping, tuna.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm sitting on twenty-five hundred in sales I can make at any time but those are my wait till the separation is legal sales.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We gotta figure this out. Think of the look on Robert's face when we tell him we met our 8% goal.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, will we get to see that look?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, that's why...that's why I said think of it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, we're gonna do our best. But you know what? At the end of the day seven point...whatever percent is pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, it is, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Have I mentioned that it's also quite good for amateur animation? [flips crude animation of stick figures representing him and Robert] Took me two weeks.
